metadata.synopsis: A Hutterite's widow (Patricia Arquette) weds her 12-year-old brother-in-law (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) to stay in the religious colony.

reviews: Holy Matrimony would be a better film had Nimoy and his writers not allowed a Hollywood-style crisis to intrude on Havana and Zeke's relationship.
...a hopelessly misguided comedy that just never manages to find its footing...
A total embarrassment; not Nimoy's best work behind the camera.
